description.p: Generates a JSON object for populating a Calendar Control with data from a DBF or SQL data source.

prototypes.prototype: dim jsonData as c = a5_getCalendarEventDataJSON(defn as p)

argument.name: defn
argument.description: An object that defines the data source, query, and the fields that contain the event data.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of query. Can be 'sql' or 'dbf'.

property.name: connectionString
property.description: The connection string to connect to the database. Can be a named connection or an ad-hoc connection string.

property.name: tableName
property.description: The name of the table that contains the event data or SQL query to retrieve the event information from the database.

property.name: eventDate
property.description: The table column or field name from the SQL query that contains the event date.

property.name: eventId
property.description: The table column or field name from the SQL query that contains the event id.

property.name: eventName
property.description: The table column or field name from the SQL query that contains the event name.

property.name: eventDescription
property.description: The table column or field name from the SQL query that contains the event description.

return.name: jsonData
return.description: A JSON object of dates with one or more events mapped to each date as an array of objects. Each event entry has the following properties:

discussion.p: The *[xb:a5_getCalendarEventDataJSON()]* function can be used to retreive data from a SQL (or DBF) data source to display in a [Calendar control]. The Calendar control requires data to be in the following format:

description.p: where each date is a key with an array of event objects that define an id, name, and detail property.

section.title: Example: Data from a Table

description.p: Data can be retrieved from a specific table or using a SQL select statement. If the event data is contained in a single table, only the table name needs to be specified in the *[xb:defn]* property. For example:

section.example:
dim jsonData as c dim defn as p defn.type = "sql" defn.connectionString = "::Name::AADemo-Northwind" defn.tableName = "orders" defn.startDate = "1994-8-1" defn.endDate = "1994-8-31" defn.eventDate = "orderDate" defn.eventId = "orderId" defn.eventName = "orderDate" defn.eventDescription = "orderDate"
jsonData = a5_getCalendarEventDataJSON(defn)
showvar(jsonData)

section.title: Example: Using a SQL Select Statement

description.p: A SQL select statement can also be used to retrieve event data from a database. In the example below, the event name and description are created by building a concatentad string of data from the orders and customers table:

section.example:
dim jsonData as c dim defn as p defn.type = "sql" defn.connectionString = "::Name::AADemo-Northwind"
defn.tableName = <<%sql% SELECT orders.orderId as orderId, concatenate(orders.orderId, ': ', customers.companyName) as eventName, orders.orderDate as orderDate, concatenate('Order: ', orders.orderId, ': ', customers.contactName, ' ', customers.companyName) as eventDescription FROM orders orders INNER JOIN customers customers ON orders.customerId = customers.customerId %sql%
defn.startDate = "1994-8-1" defn.endDate = "1994-8-31" defn.eventDate = "orderDate" defn.eventId = "orderId" defn.eventName = "eventName" defn.eventDescription = "eventDescription"
jsonData = a5_getCalendarEventDataJSON(defn)
showvar(jsonData)
